medical_history.chief_complaint: Signs of optic neuropathy associated with retrobulbar optic nerve hemangioblastomas.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients with VHL present with symptoms such as vision loss, visual field defects, and optic nerve pallor. The symptoms can evolve radiographically without visual or neurological progression, or display clinical progression requiring surgical intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients had a history of von Hippelâ€“Lindau disease (VHL) diagnosed at a mean age of 24 years and other CNS lesions, including a significant number with retinal hemangioblastomas. A subset had previous enucleations or other ocular complications from VHL.
medical_history.family_history: Positive family history of VHL in all cases.
